usefulItems: loaf tin (25 x 9 x 10 cm), pastry brush, wire rack, oven
title: Sesame and chia seed loaf

ingredients.content: 40 g chia seeds, plus extra for garnishing
400 g water, plus extra for brushing

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a loaf tin (25 x 9 x 10 cm) and set aside.
Place rice, millet and quinoa into mixing bowl and mill <b>1 min/speed 9<b>. <b>
Add chickpea (besan) flour, buckwheat flour, arrowroot flour, coconut flour, chia seeds, xanthan gum and salt and mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place agave or coconut syrup, water and yeast into mixing bowl and warm <b> <b>2 min/37°C/speed 1<b>.<b>

Add coconut or olive oil, vinegar, eggs and reserved flour mixture and combine <b>15 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then mix for a further <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer dough into prepared loaf tin.
Leave dough to prove in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 45 minutes). Brush top of loaf with extra water, then sprinkle with sesame seeds, sea salt flakes and extra chia seeds.
Bake for 40-45 minutes (180°C) or until browned on top. Allow to cool in tin for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Slice and serve warm.

hintsAndTricks: To make your own chickpea (besan) flour, mill 40 g dried chickpeas with the rice, millet and quinoa in step 2.
To make your own buckwheat flour, mill 90 g raw buckwheat with the rice, millet and quinoa in step 2.
Serve gluten free bread fresh or toasted with your favourite jam, butter or spread.
If not served warm, allow bread to cool completely before placing into a sealable container to store until use.

Proving time may vary depending on the time of year and room temperature. Choose a warm, dark place to leave dough to prove and try covering the loaf tin with a kitchen towel to insulate if necessary. Leave for an additional 15-30 minutes if not doubled in size, a maximum of 60 minutes should be sufficient.
To ensure gluten free recipes are gluten free, always read the labels of your products to ensure no wheat or gluten has been used as part of the production process.
